description: System-generated unique key for this pending purchase order line item.
Flag indicating the line represents a stock part rather than services or misc; confirm with SME.
Internal surrogate key referencing the vendor master record for this purchase.
Business identifier/code used to reference the supplier in operations and documents.
Supplier’s name as it should appear on purchasing documents.
Internal surrogate key referencing the item/part record in the parts catalog.
Business item number or SKU used to identify the part.
Short description of the item being purchased.
Internal key for the inventory location where the item will be received.
Business code for the receiving location/warehouse.
Name of the receiving location/warehouse.
Indicates the ordered item will be issued directly to a work order or asset instead of stocked.
Supplier’s catalog or part number for the item.
Internal key referencing the related work order, when the purchase fulfills a job.
Human-readable work order number linked to this line, if applicable.
Internal key to the specific work order part requirement this purchase will fulfill; confirm with SME.
Internal key to the financial account charged for this line.
Account code used for cost allocation on this purchase line.
Description of the financial account being charged.
Internal key referencing the asset associated with this purchase, for direct issue.
Business identifier for the associated asset (unit/equipment number).
Descriptive name of the associated asset.
Internal key referencing a labor code or personnel record tied to this line; confirm with SME.
Code for the labor task or person associated with this purchase line; confirm with SME.
Description/name of the labor code or person associated; confirm with SME.
Unit of measure used on the purchase order for pricing and quantity.
Readable description of the order unit of measure.
Multiplier converting one order unit to the inventory issue unit for this item.
Inventory issue unit of measure used when stocking or issuing the item.
Readable description of the inventory issue unit.
Price per order unit before discounts and taxes.
Quantity ordered, expressed in order units.
Discount applied to the line before tax; amount vs percent may vary—confirm with SME.
Extended amount before tax, typically quantity multiplied by unit price minus discounts.
Indicates whether the line is taxable.
Tax rate applied to this line, expressed as a percentage.
Calculated tax amount for this line.
Total line amount including tax and after discounts.
Free-text notes for this line item.
Likely a reference used for demonstration/testing to a labor record; confirm with SME.
IP address of the client or service that last updated this record.
Internal key of the user who last modified the record.
Initials of the user who last modified the record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Specific bin/shelf location within the warehouse where the item is stored or received.
